item.title: US election: China congratulates Biden after long silence
item.description: China says it "respects the choice of the American people" as Russia continues to withhold well wishes.

item.title: Nagorno-Karabakh: The families burning down their own homes
item.description: Fleeing ethnic Armenians are destroying their own homes so no Azerbaijanis can move in.

item.title: Ethiopia Tigray crisis: UN warns 'war crimes' may have happened
item.description: UN human rights chief Michelle Bachelet calls for an inquiry over the killings in the Tigray region.

item.title: Dutch police give 'stop paedophile hunts' warning after Arnhem death
item.description: A police chief warns against vigilantism after a retired teacher is beaten to death by teenagers.

item.title: Footballer Salah tests positive for coronavirus
item.description: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah tests positive for coronavirus while on international duty with Egypt.

item.title: Police sorry for description of Ripper's victims
item.description: West Yorkshire Police apologises for the "tone and terminology" used by officers in the 1970s.

item.title: Mutated strain of coronavirus may 'jump back and forth'
item.description: A new coronavirus strain could potentially leap to other animals, such as mice and voles, says expert.

item.title: Friends reunion 'put back to March', says Matthew Perry
item.description: "Looks like we have a busy year coming up," tweets cast member Matthew Perry.

item.title: British Museum to help dig for Nigerian treasures
item.description: The plan for a new museum and archaeology mission follows calls for it to return its Benin Bronzes.

item.title: Black Friday vehicle emissions boom predicted
item.description: Climate change: why Black Friday needs patience

item.title: Major Indian circus goes online to beat Covid
item.description: Rambo Circus was forced to cancel shows when Covid-19 struck - so they turned to the internet.

item.title: First female general manager hired in US baseball
item.description: Kim Ng becomes the first female general manager in Major League Baseball history after being hired by the Miami Marlins.

item.title: Bangladeshi teen wins award for anti-cyberbullying app
item.description: Sadat Rahman, 17, created an app to help young people learn about and report cyberbullying.

item.title: Six-year-olds sketch rogue driver for German police
item.description: Children saw a driver smash through a barrier - and drew it for police in west Germany.

item.title: US Election 2020: Is American democracy in crisis?
item.description: The BBC's Ros Atkins looks at Donald Trump's refusal to concede and what this means for US politics.

item.title: Call of Duty: A balancing act between old and new
item.description: The boss of Call of Duty speaks to Newsbeat about the new game and its Warzone integration.

item.title: Diwali under lockdown: How two sisters will celebrate
item.description: Millions of Hindus, Sikhs, and Jains will be celebrating Diwali on Saturday, but this year is different.

item.title: Yes Sir, I Can Boogie: Why disco hit is now Scotland's unofficial anthem
item.description: Dressing room footage of jubilant players boogie-woogieing to a 70s classic has gone viral.

item.title: Quiz of the week: Who wore a balaclava at MTV's Europe awards?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: Covid-19: Birmingham care home reunites couple separated by pandemic
item.description: Betty Meredith misses her husband of 71 years so much she moves into the care home to join him.

item.title: The UK is streaming Christmas songs earlier than ever
item.description: Mariah Carey's All I Want For Christmas Is You is already in Spotify's Top 40.

item.title: US election 2020: Does this compare to 2000 Florida recount?
item.description: Donald Trump's vow to go to the Supreme Court raises comparisons with the Florida recount of 2000.

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 6 - 12 November 2020
item.description: A selection of the week's best photos from across the continent.

item.title: The Weeknd to perform Super Bowl 2021 half-time show
item.description: The Blinding Lights singer will follow in the footsteps of Lady Gaga, Prince and the Rolling Stones.

item.title: Dominic Cummings, the campaigner leaving Downing St
item.description: The controversial former Vote Leave campaign director has quit as the PM's top adviser.

item.title: Do these Republican voters accept election result?
item.description: Some 70% of Trump supporters say the election "free and fair" and are struggling to come to terms with the result.

item.title: Obama: Election fraud claims 'delegitimising' democracy
item.description: Former US President Barack Obama addresses Donald Trump's unsubstantiated election fraud claims.

item.title: Jerry Rawlings: Remembering Ghana's 'man of the people'
item.description: Ghana's longest-serving leader led by example but later fell foul of his own standards, says Akwasi Sarpong.

item.title: Fears grow for British man detained in Pakistan-administered Kashmir
item.description: Tanveer Ahmed Rafique returned to Pakistan-administered Kashmir where he has campaigned for independence.

item.title: Fact-checking the US and China on climate and environment
item.description: We fact-check US and Chinese claims about CO2 emissions, plastic waste and illegal timber.

item.title: Robots to take on more supermarket tasks
item.description: Grocery and technology firm Ocado Group is buying two robotics firms, to boost the automation of online grocery orders.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: 'My little brother needs medicine'
item.description: A BBC journalist on the fears for her family in Ethiopia's Tigray region following an outbreak of fighting.

item.title: China Muslims: Volkswagen says 'no forced labour' at Xinjiang plant
item.description: The car maker defends continued production in a Chinese region mired in allegations of rights abuses.

item.title: Two coups, two elections: Why Rawlings split Ghanaians
item.description: The former air force officer who first seized power in 1979 leaves a divided legacy.

item.title: Verstappen leads Leclerc as Mercedes struggle in second practice in Turkey
item.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen leads Ferrari's Charles Leclerc as Mercedes struggle in second practice at the Turkish Grand Prix.

item.title: France v Fiji: Autumn Nations Cup match cancelled after Covid-19 cases
item.description: France's opening Autumn Nations Cup match on Sunday is called off after a spate of coronavirus cases among opponents Fiji.

item.title: Johnson joins Casey and Frittelli in Masters lead
item.description: Dustin Johnson and Dylan Frittelli join England's Paul Casey in a share of the Masters lead at seven under par.

item.title: England v Norway friendly cancelled over Covid-19 restrictions
item.description: England's friendly against Norway, set for 1 December in Sheffield, is cancelled because the visitors are unable to travel.
